availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Bird P. Brooks (Farmer, 2nd regiment kentucky cav)

body.p: Larue County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of H. F. Brooks and Sarah Brooks. Married to Elizabeth A. Brooks. Farmer in Larue County in 1860. First lieutenant in the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) until March 29, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Larue County, Hamiltons District, p. 405A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Larue County, p. 42.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 51.
